column3: depreciation energy and other equipment costs as well as other operations costs such as content

Inventory and other costs related to the hardware we sell.

column1: Software Development Costs
We  expense  software  development  costs
column3:
to  develop  software  products  or 
the  software

column1: component  of  products  to  be  sold  leased  or  marketed  to  external  users  before  technological  feasibility  is  reached.
Technological feasibility is typically reached shortly before the release of such products. As a result development costs
that meet the criteria for capitalization were not material for the periods presented.

column2: Software development costs also include costs to develop software to be used solely to meet internal needs and

column1: cloud-based  applications  used  to  deliver  our  services.  We  capitalize  development  costs  related  to  these  software
applications once the preliminary project stage is complete and it is probable that the project will be completed and the
software  will  be  used  to  perform  the  function  intended.  Costs  capitalized  for  developing  such  software  applications
were not material for the periods presented.
Stock-based Compensation

column2: Stock-based  compensation  primarily  consists  of  Alphabet
column3:
restricted  stock  units 
RSUs.  RSUs  are  equity

column1: classified and measured at the fair market value of the underlying stock at the grant date. We recognize RSU expense
using the straight-line attribution method over the requisite service period and account for forfeitures as they occur.

column2: For RSUs shares are issued on the vesting dates net of the applicable statutory income tax withholding to be

column1: paid by us on behalf of our employees. As a result fewer shares are issued than the number of RSUs outstanding and
the income tax withholding is recorded as a reduction to additional paid-in capital.

column2: Additionally  stock-based  compensation  includes  other  stock-based  awards  such  as  performance  stock  units

column1: PSUs that include market conditions and awards that may be settled in cash or the stock of certain Other ets. PSUs
and certain Other et awards are equity classified and expense is recognized over the requisite service period. Certain
Other et awards are liability classified and remeasured at fair value through settlement. The fair value of Other et
awards is based on the equity valuation of the respective Other et.
Advertising and Promotional Expenses

column2: We  expense  advertising  and  promotional  costs  in  the  period  in  which  they  are  incurred.  For  the  years  ended

column1: December  31  2020  2021  and  2022  advertising  and  promotional  expenses  totaled  approximately  5.4  billion  7.9
billion and 9.2 billion respectively.
Performance Fees

column2: Performance  fees  refer  to  compensation  arrangements  with  payouts  based  on  realized  returns  from  certain

column1: investments.  We  record  compensation  expense  based  on  the  estimated  payouts  on  an  ongoing  basis  which  may
result in expense recognized before investment returns are realized and compensation is paid and may require the use
of unobservable inputs. Performance fees are recorded as a component of other income expense net.
Fair Value Measurements

column2: Fair value is an exit price representing the amount that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a

column1: liability in an orderly transaction between market participants. As such fair value is a market-based measurement that
is  determined  based  on  assumptions  that  market  participants  would  use  in  pricing  an  asset  or  a  liability. Assets  and
